title: Tax return deadline: 10 things you need to do to get it done today
text:
Now that the Christmas and New Year festivities have well and truly concluded, time is of the essence if you still need to get your affairs in order ahead of the Jan 31 deadline to submit your tax return electronically.

So far this year, approximately 52pc of taxpayers have already filed their self-assessment returns, which leaves around 5.5 million taxpayers with around two weeks to complete their return.

History tells us that come February, a significant number of people will have missed the deadline and therefore run the risk of incurring an immediate £100 fine. Last year, this was more than 750,000 people.

For those who have left it to the last minute, here are my top 10 tips for making...
description: Now that the Christmas and New Year festivities have well and truly concluded, time is of the essence if you still need to get your affairs in order ahead of the Jan 31 deadline to submit your tax return electronically.
